me.filoghost.chestcommands.api

Interface PlaceholderReplacer

  • Functional Interface:
    This is a functional interface and can therefore be used as the assignment target for a lambda expression or method reference.

    @FunctionalInterface
public interface PlaceholderReplacer
    Callback to provide a placeholder replacement.
    Since:
    1

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      @Nullable String getReplacement(@NotNull Player player, @Nullable String argument)
      Callback for providing a placeholder replacement, given a player and the argument of the placeholder (if present).

    • Method Detail

      • getReplacement

        @Nullable
@Nullable String getReplacement(@NotNull
                                          @NotNull Player player,
                                          @Nullable
                                          @Nullable String argument)
        Callback for providing a placeholder replacement, given a player and the argument of the placeholder (if present).

        For example, the placeholder {test} has a null argument and the placeholder {test: hello world} has the string argument "hello world".

        If this method returns null, the placeholder is not replaced. It is preferred to return a descriptive error message rather than returning null.

        Warning: this method should be performance efficient, as it may be invoked quite often.

        Parameters:
        player - the player viewing the placeholder
        argument - the argument inside the placeholder, if present
        Returns:
        the placeholder replacement, null to not replace
        Since:
        1
        See Also:
        ChestCommandsAPI.registerPlaceholder(Plugin, String, PlaceholderReplacer)
